item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JHWRJPRQ0G1S0YY8H2FM0S0X
item.description:
Today I learned that in #Todoist you can create a note that you can’t accidentally tick as complete by startingthe task name with “*” www.reddit.com/∞

You can further include notes in the filters with the query term “uncompletable”.
item.content:encoded:
Today I learned that in #Todoist you can create a note that you can’t accidentally tick as complete by startingthe task name with “*” www.reddit.com/∞

You can further include notes in the filters with the query term “uncompletable”.

item.title: EvosHosting Discussion on LowEndTalk
item.description:
EvosHosting Discussion on LowEndTalk

Purchased two storage VPS from EvosHosting at a discounted rate, but the experience has been frustrating, with delays in provisioning, price increases, downtime, and lack of support. While they offer cheap deals, reliability and customer service leave much to be desired.
Unfortunately, experienced downtime with my VPS with EvosHosting today as well. It has been several months. No response from the customer support.
item.content:encoded:
EvosHosting Discussion on LowEndTalk

Purchased two storage VPS from EvosHosting at a discounted rate, but the experience has been frustrating, with delays in provisioning, price increases, downtime, and lack of support. While they offer cheap deals, reliability and customer service leave much to be desired.
Unfortunately, experienced downtime with my VPS with EvosHosting today as well. It has been several months. No response from the customer support.

item.title: RTM Todoist Migration
item.description:
RTM Todoist Migration

A utility to help migrate tasks from RememberTheMilk (RTM) to Todoist.
I might have been halfway through there before I stumbled upon this repo. Good to know for reference, though.
item.content:encoded:
RTM Todoist Migration

A utility to help migrate tasks from RememberTheMilk (RTM) to Todoist.
I might have been halfway through there before I stumbled upon this repo. Good to know for reference, though.

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JHTC2BFB93ZR9GB0QBPEV7YF
item.description: I’m not even sure if it’s a good decision to stick with #RememberTheMilk. It’s an old system, with hardly any improvements introduced in the recent years. Just look at their forums, a lot of feature requests that remained open, for quite a number of years even. #RTM #Productivity
item.content:encoded: I’m not even sure if it’s a good decision to stick with #RememberTheMilk. It’s an old system, with hardly any improvements introduced in the recent years. Just look at their forums, a lot of feature requests that remained open, for quite a number of years even. #RTM #Productivity

item.title: @deuts@deuts.one 01JHQ2VBR3E078169GF45KBFNJ
item.description:
I filed a dispute on #PayPal, requesting a $10 refund due to my poor experience with the #SliceHosting VPS hosting company. More details here: deuts.org/∞

To my surprise, the refund was credited almost instantly to my PayPal balance.

Big thanks to LowEndBox for guiding me in the right direction: lowendbox.com/∞
item.content:encoded:
I filed a dispute on #PayPal, requesting a $10 refund due to my poor experience with the #SliceHosting VPS hosting company. More details here: deuts.org/∞

To my surprise, the refund was credited almost instantly to my PayPal balance.

Big thanks to LowEndBox for guiding me in the right direction: lowendbox.com/∞

item.title: Claude (Anthropic) API support for OpenWebUI
item.description:
Claude (Anthropic) API support for OpenWebUI

I often use Claude from Anthropic for some use cases, as it has some advantages. But I’d love to do it in Open WebUI so I can keep all my chat records in one place.

I’d like to propose support for the Anthropic API in the same way that OpenAI API is supported.

I echo this sentiment. I hope the developers of OpenWebUI would consider adding it in the connections.
item.content:encoded:
Claude (Anthropic) API support for OpenWebUI

I often use Claude from Anthropic for some use cases, as it has some advantages. But I’d love to do it in Open WebUI so I can keep all my chat records in one place.

I’d like to propose support for the Anthropic API in the same way that OpenAI API is supported.

I echo this sentiment. I hope the developers of OpenWebUI would consider adding it in the connections.

item.title: @deuts.hamili.net 3lfobmaofqc2v
item.description: I have to block a few spam accounts here already on #Bluesky. Some are even crypto scammers.
item.content:encoded: I have to block a few spam accounts here already on #Bluesky. Some are even crypto scammers.

item.title: Fediwall
item.description:
Fediwall

Social media wall for the Fediverse.
We need to learn how to selfhost this thing, so we don’t have to rely on third-party services.
item.content:encoded:
Fediwall

Social media wall for the Fediverse.
We need to learn how to selfhost this thing, so we don’t have to rely on third-party services.
